title.narrative: STRENGTHENED NATIONAL Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) GOVERNANCE

description.narrative: National Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) Programme Management Unit have strengthened capacity to lead and coordinate Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) sector and ensure that key governance functions for the Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) sector are in place, including during emergencies., which contributes to Evaluation, Research, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

sector.narrative: Overall WASH – systems strengthening (e.g. sector-wide coordination, enabling environment and financing advocacy)
Water sector policy and administrative management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National WASH Programme Management Unit have strengthened capacity to lead and coordinate WASH sector and ensure that keygovernance functions for the WASH sector are in place, including during emergencies.

description.narrative: Throughout 2021, UNICEF continued to strengthen the rollout of the National WASH Policy. The WASH Programme Management Unit (PMU) operationalised the WASH MIS to monitor WASH Sector progress and the National WASH Advocacy & Communication Strategy was endorsed and launched. The four focus districts that rolled out the WASH Service Delivery Arrangements (WSDA) in 2019 used the guidance to plan their resource investment in WASH services. AWASH Bottleneck Analysis (WASHBAT) conducted in Goroka District enabled the development of a District WASH Capacity Development Plan; the WASH PMU and NDOH adopted the national Community-Led Total Sanitation (CLTS) manual developed. . | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/12/2021
